content:
The Twin Cities will be having our first regularly scheduled BackdropCMS.org meetup in two weeks:
https://www.meetup.com/Twin-Cities-BackdropCMS-User-Group/

Twin Cities Backdrop CMS User Group (Minneapolis, MN)
For people interested in Backdrop Content Management System. We'll talk about how to use Backdrop CMS and contribute to the project.

Anyone interested in a SE Michigan meetup?

Elisabeth

https://cmsphilly.org/ -- seems like a "anyone with a CMS is welcome" sorta event. If anyone is in philly area it's in May and Call for Proposals opens soon. This used to be Drupal specific (DrupalDelphia) and is changing scope this year.
The organizers of both the SandCamp and DrupalCampLA events talked about doing something similar two years ago, but nothing different came about from those talks.

@oadaeh (Jason Flatt) It's part of why I think there's a real opportunity for communities that embrace their code differences and unite on principles of community foundation. I think we'll see more and more FOSS devs go "what is it I'm ultimately helping support my client or that 1 mega corporation"

Are there any documents already written that might be helpful as I write up the Venue Use Request for the NYC Event?
Something that might include a quick explanation of what backdrop is that I could adapt to this?
@ericfg best resource I can think for something like that is https://backdropcms.org/about

well, good news and bad. We have use of space at Barnard College Library's Milstein Center for Teaching and Learning https://library.barnard.edu/spaces if we want it

bad news: Columbia U and Barnard College are likely ending all in-person classes this week until, well, no one is sure.

But since librarians and staff are considered expendable, the space will still be open and staffed if we want to use it
the part about librarians being expendable sucks, that will probably be the case in public library land too

oh yeah. it's much worse in public library land, and even in public university land. CUNY is mostly commuter students, no classes cancelled. only the elite universities have the resources to switch to online mid semester for all classes

Regarding NYC event. I think that planning any events that involve travel is very risky these days. If your target is primarily a local audience, it might still make sense. It's very hard to predict what the mood will be next week, let alone next month. @ericfg

@StPaulTim I am thinking that even a small local event is not a great idea at the moment.
I'd prefer to wait until the chaos clears and do it then
No rush, better to make sure it's a good and diverse event
@ericfg - That makes good sense to me.
The good news is that this location is open to hosting future events
Possibly some folks there are even excited to
Anyone else going to attend the virtual MidCamp?
I might participate in Midcamp. I was registered and have been to Midcamp every year, but I mostly go for networking and BOFs.
